Issues.Title: fix(ivy): provide an ability to match <ng-template> tags
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, we were unable to match directives using `ng-template` tags (for example the following selector would not work even though there might be some <ng-template>s in a template: `ng-template[directiveA]`. As a result, that broke some components that relies on such selectors to work. In order to resolve the problem, we now pass tag name to the `template` instruction (where we passed `null` before) and this tag name is used for matching at runtime. This update should also help support projecting containers, because the tag name is required to properly match such elements.

Issue Number: FW-818.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): provide an ability to match <ng-template> tags" (#27636)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): fix major/minor semver check between @angular/bazel npm pâ€¦
Issues.Body:
â€¦ackage version and angular bazel repo version

Was updating rules_typescript with the semver check (https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/pull/352) and noticed the logic error in the check where using `~major.minor.patch` as the condition means the version being checked must be`>= major.minor.patch` whereas using `major.minor.x` as the condition means the version being checked must only match on major and minor and can have any patch version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(bazel): fix major/minor semver check between @angular/bazel npm pâ€¦" (#27635)

Issues.Title: Angular Animations translateY on Chrome on iPhone finishes early
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/animations ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I have a scroll animation in my app which uses translateY to translate the body to the next question in a list after the previous question is answered. This behavior is working fine on desktop on all browsers, and in mobile in Safari. However, for certain iPhone's on Chrome the transition finishes in under 100ms when it is supposed to finish in 700ms, causing a noticeable skip. I was able to reproduce the issue in Chrome on an iPhone 6, 6S and XR. However, an iPhone 8 did not have the problem. ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-reqqdv ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error
## ğŸŒ Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 7.1.2
Node: 8.11.2
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.1.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.11.2

rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.27.1
**Anything else relevant?** iPhone 6, 6S and XR reproduce the issue in Chrome. It always works in Safari. iPhone 8 in Chrome works. Screen recordings showing the issue: iPhone XR - Safari (Working): https://youtu.be/fM6-hh_L1_Y iPhone XR - Chrome (Broken): https://youtu.be/d_WblMfK3nc iPhone 6 - Chrome (Broken): https://youtu.be/WT6cHR-ZhlI iPhone 6S - Chrome (Broken): https://youtu.be/kqvE2zqf4wc iPhone 8 - Chrome (Working): https://youtu.be/h9oP8Jc0Ix4 Desktop - Chrome (MacBook Pro, Working): https://youtu.be/j93sqSXjIMI

Issues.Title: Access failed ActivatedRouteSnapshot in NavigationError
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ Access failed ActivatedRouteSnapshot in NavigationError

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- âœï¸edit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router. Specifically, /packages/router/src/router.ts.

### Description
I have the following scenario:

1. user clicks a link to go to a new page
1. one of the resolvers for that page fails with a very specific error (let's say, missing permissions)
1. I listen on NavigationError events
1. I catch the NavigationError event. It contains the error raised in step 2 and the URL the user was trying to reach.
1. I'd like to be able to configure (in the route configuration) where to redirect the user when this specific error occurs. But I don't have the handle to ActivatedRouteSnapshot for the page the user was trying to reach, and so I cannot access its "data" property where I wrote the configuration.

A sample route configuration could look like this:

    @NgModule({
        ...
        RouterModule.forChild([{
           data: {
               permissionConfig: {...}
    }}])})

### Describe the solution you'd like
Ideally, I'd like the failed ActivatedRouteSnapshot to be a field of NavigationError. It's important for it to be the "leaf" ActivatedRouteSnapshot, not the root one, as it's in the leaf where I put my permissionConfig.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Currently I'm using the following workaround: I have a "fake" route guard, with a canActivate call that always returns of(true), but remembers its arguments (ActivatedRouteSnapshot and RouterStateSnapshot) on "global" variables that I can access later when handling the NavigationError elsewhere. I'm also clearing this global state every NavigationStart so that there's no risk of using the wrong snapshot later.

The downside of the workaround is that I have to add the fake guard to every @NgModule that uses permissionConfig. If I forget to do it, it doesn't work. And I cannot add my fake guard to the root @NgModule (to RouterModule.forRoot), because then the ActivatedRouteSnapshot I receive is the root snapshot and I have no means of knowing which of its children I should descend to to find my configuration (there can be multiple children because of outlets).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Access failed ActivatedRouteSnapshot in NavigationError" (#27626)

Issues.Title: memory leak with dynamically created nodes using angular animation
Issues.Body:
memory leak with dynamically created nodes using angular animation.

Minimal reproduction:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-xsujwd 
(works better in normal dev environment without using stackblitz)


I use chrome devtool to inspect DOM node number.

STEP 1: garbage collect and then observe DOM number.
STEP 2: click 'create' button several times (for a more obvious result).
STEP 3: click 'destroy' button for each dynamic component.
STEP 4: garbage collect.
STEP 5: observe DOM number.

Found an increased DOM number in STEP 5 compared to STEP 1.

works fine without angular animation.


-----------------------------------------
Edit: works ok after I restarted the project, might be something wrong with hot-reloading. Anyway, it was my bad..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "memory leak with dynamically created nodes using angular animation" (#27622)

Issues.Title: Router named outlet in child route of an empty path doesn't work
Issues.Body:
# ğŸ bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I have a route with empty path, and in it's children I would like to define a named outlet route in the following way. ```ts { path: '', children: [ { path: 'mywidget', component: MyWidgetComponent, outlet: 'widget', }, { path: '', component: MainPageComponent, } ] }, { path: 'other', component: OtherPageComponent }, ``` This config fails with the following error. ``` Error: Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot match any routes. URL Segment: 'mywidget' Error: Cannot match any routes. URL Segment: 'mywidget' ``` Giving a path name to the parent route solve the problem, but I would like to use an empty path there because it's a default route. ```ts { path: 'main', children: [ { path: 'mywidget', component: MyWidgetComponent, outlet: 'widget', }, { path: '', component: MainPageComponent, } ] }, { path: 'other', component: OtherPageComponent }, ``` ## ğŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction Not working: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-named-outlet-empty-path](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-named-outlet-empty-path) And this is the fix that I'm trying to avoid: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-routing-child-named-outlet](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-routing-child-named-outlet) ## ğŸ”¥ Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Confirmation event to child component from parent component
Issues.Body:
Hi Folks, First of all, I am sorry to post support question here.
I posted this in SO but no response yet, or my question itself might be wrong please let me know anything on this.

**Context:**
Working on generic data table with inline edit feature.

**Components:**
component - data-table.component.(ts|html|css)

**Process:**
- This is a generic data table, can be used just by passing columns and rows to display. 
- It has inline edit feature for some of the cells
- On edit complete, an event will be sent to feature component(parent).
- Business logic to handle save data is up to the feature component(parent).

**Question:**
**- Save is an async process, on complete of save, how can I send confirmation response back to data table component if the save was success or fail ?**

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Confirmation event to child component from parent component" (#27617)

Issues.Title: Support ::slotted() in ViewEncapsulation.Emulated
Issues.Body:
# ğŸš€ feature request

This was discussed previously in #11595 and (incorrectly) closed as complete by @robwormald.

### Relevant Package

@angular/core

### Description

::slotted() is part of the Shadow DOM [working draft](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-scoping/#slotted-pseudo) (see also [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::slotted)), with significant support by vendors. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

ViewEncapsulation.Emulated supports ::slotted(), following the behavior in the Shadow DOM specification.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

ViewEncapsulation.Native is a viable alternative for some browsers.

However, neither IE or Edge supports ::slotted and Safari support is buggy (https://caniuse.com/#feat=shadowdomv1).

::ng-deep is currently the only viable alternative, but Angular has deprecated it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support ::slotted() in ViewEncapsulation.Emulated" (#27614)

Issues.Title: Prompts should not accept empty string as a value for required options
Issues.Body:
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

Currently, if an option is marked as required in the schema the schematics CLI will error if no value is passed for that option in non-interactive mode. However, if you are interactive mode and don't provide a value for a required option at its prompt, it is interpreted as having the "value" of the empty string.

You can work around this by adding validation to your schema to not accept the empty string, but that defeats the purpose / convenience of marking options as required.

Prompts should reject the empty string as a value for required options.

(Not quite sure whether this qualifies as a bug or FR).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Prompts should not accept empty string as a value for required options" (#13183)

Issues.Body:

```
-----------------------------------------------------------

webpack                           4.19.1
```

### Repro steps
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.
Please include: commands run (incl args), packages added, related code changes.
A link to a sample repo would help too.
-->
I have this in my base `tsconfig.json` file
```
{
    "compileOnSave": false,
    "compilerOptions": {
        "outDir": "./dist/out-tsc",
        "baseUrl": "src",
        "sourceMap": true,
        "declaration": false,
        "moduleResolution": "node",
        "emitDecoratorMetadata": true,
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "target": "es5",
        "typeRoots": [
            "node_modules/@types"
        ],
        "lib": [
            "es2016",
            "dom"
        ],
        "noEmit": false,
        "noImplicitAny": false
    }
}
```
I have this in my `tsconfig.app.json`
```
{
    "extends": "../tsconfig.json",
    "compilerOptions": {
        "outDir": "../out-tsc/app",
        "module": "es2015",
        "baseUrl": "src",
        "types": [
            "jquery",
            "node"
        ]
    },
    "exclude": [
        "test.ts",
        "**/*.spec.ts",
        "**/*.mock.ts",
        "node_modules",
        "dist"
    ]
}
```
My modules are lazy loaded like this:
```
{
  path: 'projects',
  loadChildren: './modules/projects/projects-hub.module#ProjectsModule'
},
```
Where projects.routing module looks like this:
```
const appRoutes: Routes = [
    {
        path: '',
        component: ProjectsHubComponent,
        canActivate: [AuthenticatedRedirectGuardService, IframeUnloadGuardService]
    }
];

@NgModule({
    imports: [
        RouterModule.forChild(appRoutes)
    ],
    exports: [
        RouterModule
    ]
})
export class ProjectsHubRoutingModule {
}
```
My `angular.json` build configuration for this app looks like this
```
"projects": {
        "my-angular-app": {
            "root": "",
            "sourceRoot": "src",
            "projectType": "application",
            "architect": {
                "build": {
                    "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
                    "options": {
                        "outputPath": "build\\application",
                        "index": "src/index.html",
                        "main": "src/main.ts",
                        "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.app.json",
                        "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts",
                        "assets": [
                            "src/assets",
                            "src/favicon.ico"
                        ],
                        "styles": [
                            "src/styles.css",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.core.css",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.snow.css"
                        ],
                        "scripts": [
                            "node_modules/chart.js/dist/Chart.bundle.min.js",
                            "node_modules/quill/dist/quill.js"
                        ]
                    },
                    "configurations": {
                        "production": {
                            "optimization": true,
                            "outputHashing": "none",
                            "sourceMap": false,
                            "extractCss": false,
                            "namedChunks": false,
                            "aot": true,
                            "extractLicenses": true,
                            "vendorChunk": false,
                            "buildOptimizer": true,
                            "fileReplacements": [
                                {
                                    "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts",
                                    "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        "dev": {
                            "optimization": true,
                            "outputHashing": "none",
                            "sourceMap": true,
                            "extractCss": false,
                            "namedChunks": true,
                            "aot": false,
                            "extractLicenses": true,
                            "vendorChunk": false,
                            "buildOptimizer": false
                        }
                    }
                },
```

We put our files on the server in an `/angular/files/dist` folder, in version 5 this used to lazy load things fine from `/angular/files/dist/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js` but now, no amount of changing the `baseHref` in my `angular.json` or changing the `baseUrl` in either of my `tsconfig.json` files will get files to load from here. I have tried setting baseHref/baseUrl to `""`, `"./"`, `"src"`, and even `"/"`, just to see, in all files; but no matter what, they all seem to want to load from `/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js` and produce a 404 for literally every module file. 

### The log given by the failure
<!-- Normally this include a stack trace and some more information. -->
`GET http://localhost/modules-projects-projects-hub-module.js net::ERR_ABORTED 404 (Not Found)`

### Desired functionality
<!--
What would like to see implemented?
What is the usecase?
-->
I would like to lazy load chunks from the relative path of wherever my angular files are actually located. I feel like this is probably possible (as it was in V5) and I have very likely just misconfigured something, but I can't seem to figure it out and am seeking advice.

Issues.Title: ng update ignores proxy config
Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report -> please search issues before submitting
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

issue was partially discussed here (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10624) after .npmrc issues and later (original issue solved) determined that there is a different issue.

1. **we use yarn with a private repo behind a corporate proxy.**
2. local .npmrc:
   `registry=[some url, masked out]
   always-auth=true`
3. yarn lock contains packages where I see some as resolved with [some url, masked out]
   also there are packages with `https://registry.yarnpkg.com/some-package-and-so-on`
4. global .yarnrc (in C:\Users\MyUserName):
```
# THIS IS AN AUTOGENERATED FILE. DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE DIRECTLY.
# yarn lockfile v1
lastUpdateCheck 1543945019859
```
5. global .npmrc (in C:\Users\MyUserName):
```
//some_path_with_some_token
proxy= http://our_proxy_with_port/
https-proxy= http://our_proxy_with_port
```
6. trying to follow commands from update.angular.io
7. `yarn install` works, everything else from 6. works but not `ng update @angular/cli`, message comes up after a while (1 minute or so):
`request to https://registry.npmjs.org/@types%2fjasmine failed, reason: connect ETIMEDOUT`
seems to be on a random package, at another try I got:
`request to https://registry.npmjs.org/codelyzer failed, reason: connect ETIMEDOUT [some ip address and port]`


**Assumption:**

**It seems that ng update @angular/cli ignores the proxy since it should go to the configured proxy or https-proxy instead of npmjs.org.**

Should the command be ng update @angular/cli@next? (Results in same error message)
P.S.  I tried migrate only - which works - and then update the packages via yarn, also works. 
I just think that I might miss something that ng update does as well, other than migrating to the angular.json file and lifting the packages to the recent version.

8. currently still running angular 5.1.1
9. tried as described with @next option in `yarn global add @angular/cli@next` and `yarn add @angular/cli@next
`
10. ng --version:
```
     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |

 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

Node: 8.12.0
OS: win32 x64

... http, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
```

Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)

### Command (mark with an `x`)

Issues.Title: MatSelect `focused` property is incorrect
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

MatSelect's `focused` property should be `false` when a `blur` callback is triggered after clicking outside of the options panel.

#### What is the current behavior?

MatSelect's `focused` property is `true` when the `blur` callback is triggered after clicking outside of the options panel. However, `focused` is then `false` after a short period of time has elapsed.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Visit the following Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-891tlg
1. Click outside the options panel to close the MatSelect
2. The `onBlur` callback is invoked. Observe how `FOCUSED` is logged immediately, and `not focused` is logged after 1 second.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
@angular/material 7.1.1

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatSelect `focused` property is incorrect" (#14491)

Issues.Title: mat-slide-toggle unexpected animation in certain conditions
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
MatSlideToggle shouldn't display an animation after rendering with given state

#### What is the current behavior?
MatSlideToggle display a slide animation from off -> on in certain conditions

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pzaey9?file=animation-bug.component.ts

Click EDIT -> then click the "SAVE WITH BUG" button -> unexpected animation

OS: Windows10 / Chrome 70.0.3538.110 (64-bit) (it works well on Firefox, Edge, IE11)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Making one of the following fixes this behaviour:
- removing animation from Component declaration (I need it in my component)
- moving button above SlideToggle
- setting additional *ngIf on SlideToggle

Issues.Title: [Dialog] Add a directive to simplify dialog interaction
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
A directive that accepts a TemplateRef and a dialog configuration object
When the button this directive is placed on is clicked a dialog containing that Template is created

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Allows users to interact with dialogs like other components - through their markup bindings. No need to use poorly understood _entry components_. Dialog templates are part of the component template; input and output bindings are fully accessible (as are pipes.)

The existing programmatic only approach feels like there is a lot of ceremony over creating dialogs - many of which would otherwise be simple components.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
I've stubbed out what the implementation might look like here. I've used a version of this in production for over a year now. I've also included 2 examples of usage. 
https://github.com/adammedford/material2/blob/open-dialog-directive/src/lib/dialog/dialog-open-directive.ts

I will submit a PR if there is interest in this; this version is to just convey what I'm talking about. I didn't want to go through the effort of a full implementation and docs if nobody cares to use it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Dialog] Add a directive to simplify dialog interaction" (#14483)

Issues.Title: Setting steps to completed programatically does not change class mat-step-icon-not-touched
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug/feature request #### What is the expected behavior? When I am using a stepper as an edit/create wizard, I auto-populate the data, and set each step to completed and set the state to edit. I expect this to remove the class `mat-step-icon-not-touched`. #### What is the current behavior? Does not remove class. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? In order to trigger proper UI states to show edibility of all steps that have data injected. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? angular 5 material 5 #### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Setting steps to completed programatically does not change class mat-step-icon-not-touched" (#14481)

Issues.Title: fix(checkbox): incorrect color for disabled indeterminate checkbox
Issues.Body:
When we were implementing the new Material Design spec, [we based our checkbox state off this design](https://camo.githubusercontent.) which shows selected disabled checkboxes to be greyed out, whereas indeterminate disabled checkboxes having a slight opacity. After checking with the MDC team, the above-mentioned designs are incorrect and all disabled checkboxes are supposed to be grey.

Fixes #14415.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(checkbox): incorrect color for disabled indeterminate checkbox" (#14478)

Issues.Title: fix(expansion-panel): picking up lazy content from child component
Issues.Body:
We use a `ContentChild` to determine what lazy content to render inside an expansion panel. When the lazy content is nested further down inside another expansion panel, all ancestor panels up the tree will pick up the lowest lazy content from the lowest level. These changes add a check to ensure that the lazy content is rendered out by the closest panel.

Fixes #14365.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(expansion-panel): picking up lazy content from child component" (#14477)

Issues.Title: build: fix e2e tests failing due to chromedriver release (#14461)
Issues.Body:
Apparently the webdriver-manager always uses the _latest_ version of the chromedriver. This is problematic because the CI does not always use the latest chrome version that _works_ with the chromedriver from `webdriver-manager`.

In order to fix this, we lock the webdriver manager version to a specific version. Similarly to how it's done for `angular/angular`.

Note that this also restricts which Chrome versions can be run locally with the e2e tests, but the chromedriver range seems to always cover at least the latest two versions (which works for us)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix e2e tests failing due to chromedriver release (#14461)" (#14475)

Issues.Title: Allow more colors on a theme
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
It would be great if we could have more than just primary, accent and warn colors.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
It is very hard to use only 3 colors on the entire application, and even tho it is possible to use css classes, when you create an application supporting multiple themes, it gets hard to maintain it as application grows.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It also would be great if we could have an extra directive to define what color shade from the palette we want to use as base. 

For Example.: `<button color="accent" colorShade="300">Button</button>`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow more colors on a theme" (#14474)

Issues.Title: fix(checkbox): redirect focus to underlying input element
Issues.Body:
Currently the `mat-checkbox` host element isn't focusable, which means that if consumers decided to use something like `cdkFocusInitial` on it, nothing would happen. These changes tweak the `tabindex` so the element is focusable and add a `focus` listener that'll redirect focus to the `input`.

Relates to #13953.

**Note:** this is a resubmit of #13959.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(checkbox): redirect focus to underlying input element" (#14473)

Issues.Title: fix(radio): host element unable to receive focus events
Issues.Body:
In #13323 we started clearing the `tabindex` from the `host` element in order to avoid having two elements with the same `tabindex` when the consumer sets a custom `tabindex`. As a result, the `mat-radio-button` can no longer receive focus and forward it to the `input`. These changes always reset the `tabindex` to -1 so the element is focusable, but not tabbable.

Fixes #13953.

**Note:** this is a resubmit of #13956.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(radio): host element unable to receive focus events" (#14472)

Issues.Title: fix(a11y): activeItem out of date if active index is removed from ListKeyManager
Issues.Body:
Fixes the `activeItem` on the `ListKeyManager` not matching the item at the `activeItemIndex`, if the `activeItem` is removed from the list.

Fixes #14345.

**Note:** this is a resubmit of #14407.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(a11y): activeItem out of date if active index is removed from ListKeyManager" (#14471)

Issues.Title: build: increase saucelabs connect timeout
Issues.Body:
At some point we went down from a 2min wait timeout to 30seconds because we re-ran the startup script if something failed. Since re-running didn't really help and we removed it, we should move the timeout back to a longer period.

```
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Sauce Connect 4.5.2, build 4485 4a87b52 
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Using CA certificate bundle /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt.
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Using CA certificate verify path /etc/ssl/certs.
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Starting up; pid 414
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Command line arguments: sauce-connect/bin/sc -u angular-ci -k **** --readyfile /tmp/material-saucelabs/readyfile --pidfile /tmp/material-saucelabs/pidfile --tunnel-identifier angular-material-25254-0 
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Log file: /tmp/sc-angular-material-25254-0.log
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Pid file: /tmp/material-saucelabs/pidfile
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Timezone: UTC GMT offset: 0h
11 Dec 17:38:29 - Using no proxy for connecting to Sauce Labs REST API.
11 Dec 17:38:31 - Started scproxy on port 40078.
11 Dec 17:38:31 - Please wait for 'you may start your tests' to start your tests.

// EXIT Timeout (30 seconds)

```

e.g. see: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/material2/25254 where it successfully acquired a tunnel, but just didn't have enough time to actually establish it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: increase saucelabs connect timeout" (#14470)
